results.title: The Peep show
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low, Tom Daly and Kaj Pindal
results.brief_description: A cartoon film for young children about the adventures of a little chick from the time he falls from an egg basket and breaks out of his shell. Together with a duck who happens along, he goes to explore the world and discovers there is much to learn, even about his own farmyard. Voice and narration by Stanley Jackson.

results.title: The Pedlar
results.creator_credit: Michael Scott, ONF | NFB and Allan Kroeker
results.brief_description: The Pedlar is a dramatic film based on the short story by W.D. Valgardson, A Place of One’s Own. Tired of the rootless, lonely existence of a travelling merchant, a man searches for a place to settle down, and someone to share his life. Stars Lubomir Mykytiuk, Thomas Peacocke, Doreen Brownstown and Marilyn Magnusson.

results.title: The Pedestrian strikes back
results.creator_credit: Copeland Productions, KNBC (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and Jack L. Copeland
results.brief_description: Assesses the national trend of revitalising the downtown core of cities through the construction of malls, focusing upon Burbank’s Golden Mall, and comparing it with similar projects throughout California. Authorities analyse the need for malls and discuss the difficulties encountered in providing them.

results.title: The Pebble and the penguin
results.creator_credit: Russell Boland, Don Bluth Productions and Colin Mawby
results.brief_description: The Full Moon Ceremony, a real-life Adeli Penguin ritual requires that all bachelor penguins present a special pebble to their sweetheart. If she accepts, they are partners for life. Hubie, a shy penguin with a heart of gold, finds a perfect stone to present to his true love Marina. The evil Drake, another admirer casts a plot which sees Hubie expelled from the colony. Luckily as he is cast adrift into the wide world, he meets up with Rocko and together they begin the long journey back home. A life-long friendship develops and at last Hubie gets his girl.

results.title: The Peasant's pea patch: a Russian folk tale
results.creator_credit: Nick Bosustow, Xerox Films and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Desire to read”.
This tall tale from Russian folklore follows the hilarious misadventures of a Russian peasant who tries in vain to protect his pea patch from a flock of hungry cranes. The film ends with the defeated peasant illustrating that, although life can be difficult, humanity somehow manages not only to survive but to survive in good spirit.

results.title: The Peanut butter solution
results.brief_description: Nothing in 11 year old Michael Baskin’s vivid imagination can prepare him for the strange and enchanting adventure that he is about to embark on, an adventure that will change his life. Where an abandoned mansion holds a secret so frightening that it scares off little boys! Where friendly ghosts pass on magic potions made of peanut butter! Where an odd mystical artist paints pictures so real you can walk into them! And where magic and imagination are the most wonderful things of all. Rated: PG

results.title: The Peacemaker
results.brief_description: A tribute to Dag Hammarskjoeld, late Secretary General of the United Nations. His leadership in a troubled period including the Korean War, the Suez crisis, and the conflict in the Congo are featured, as are his interests in the UN agencies for relief and development. He believed strongly in a personal contact between national leaders. This in part led to his death in an aircraft crash when visiting the troubled Congo in 1961.

results.title: The Peaceful revolution
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, AEI Film Unit and Atma Ram
results.brief_description: Addresses the growth of electrical power in India and the parallel development of education and technology with their effect on heavy and light industries, methods of agriculture and upon living conditions in the villages and cities. International contributions to this peaceful revolution are underlined, and outstanding technological achievements seen include hydroelectric projects, the Durgapur steel plant, and the electrical engineering services at Bhopal.

results.title: The Peace War
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
The Peace War looks at the growing power of peace movements in Europe and the propaganda victories won by the proponents of nuclear disarmament. Examines the arguments for and against the Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament in Britain.

results.title: The Peace makers: 1919
results.creator_credit: Peter Baylis, Associated British-Pathe and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Highlights some of the events immediately following the end of World War I, such as the Versailles Peace Treaty Conference, the return of soldiers to America and Britain, the Great Victory Parade in London and the crossing of the Atlantic by Alcock and Brown. Narrated by Sir Ralph Richardson. Suitable for upper secondary level.
